summary: In season 8 sansa is officially Tully like her mother. D&D finally returning with book version where is million times explanes...
body:
In season 8 sansa is officially Tully like her mother. D&D finally returning with book version where is million times explanes that Sansa is more Tully than Stark.

D&D, HBO And Michelle Clapton officially kills the theiry about Jonsa . Sansa isn’t wolf.

You can enter with Michelle Clapton Insta Account where Someone wrote that Sansa’s dress and new photo poster means that she tries to be like Cersei. And her dress style is inspired from Cersei. And Michelle liked her comentar.

Tullys are always associate with lie, betrayal … how Catelyn betrayed to Robb when she helped Jaime to escape from Riveran. We all remember absolutely identical “The King In the North “ scene in season 6 final.

If Dany’s kidnaped theory is right. There is Tyrion and Sansa’s hand.

Catelyn didn’t like Talysa/jane = Sansa will not like Dany

Catelyn helped Jaime to escape from Riveran and Rob lost his war= Sansa and Tyrion informs to Cersei about Dany’s pregnacy . Cersei send Golden Company in North to take Dany because she already had miscarriage and lost her baby. She hasn’t heir and Dany is pregnant. Jon Lost Dany and Night King attachs Winterfell. Dragons will be in mess while their mother disappear. Jon can’t control situation and they lost Winterfell too.


Parallel

summary: Rewatching Jon die in S5 is still as gut wrenching as the first time, he's been my favorite character since the beginning and I...
body:
Rewatching Jon die in S5 is still as gut wrenching as the first time, he’s been my favorite character since the beginning and I loved his story arc even more than Daenerys so seeing him dying still hurts, everything about the scene is so heartbreaking from the way it’s shot to the way the music plays the Stark theme in the background. Like I still get that sunken feeling when I see Jon’s emotions play out in the scene, from disbelief to betrayal and the way he looks at Olly like maybe there’s hope but soon realizes that that’s not the case and Olly stabs in the heart like fuck my heart hurts when I see it. Like I know Jon comes back and gets his revenge but still to know that the men you once trusted and fought with in battle would betray you like that is so fucked up. All Jon wanted to do was save people from a horrible fates and be a good enough leader for his men and was still betrayed. Like Jon has been fighting his whole life to do the right thing and boy deserves some happiness and rest so if I have to see him die all over again you bet your ass I’m gonna be on the floor crying.

I JUST WANT MY SNOWY BABY TO BE HAPPY AND LIVE A LONG LIFE WITH DAENERYS WITH GHOST AND THE DRAGONS AND THEIR 4 KIDS DAMMIT!!!!!

summary:
Sam: Can you take me to the mall to get a dress?

Jon: Okay. First of all, I’m so glad you felt comfortable enough to come to me...
body:
Sam: Can you take me to the mall to get a dress?

Jon: Okay. First of all, I’m so glad you felt comfortable enough to come to me with that, and you know what? If this is something you want to explore-

Sam: Oh, it’s not for me. It’s for Gilly, but you handled that very well.

blog.name: jonsa101
blog.title: Jonsa101
blog.description: #Jonsa and #Sharpwin Meta Writer. Pop Culture Obsessed. Lover of Street Style.

title: Quick Thoughts on Sansa’s Dress...
body:
Ok so I’m not a costume meta writer but I really wanted to give my thoughts on Sansa’s dress. In my personal opinion, Michele Clapton knocked it out of the park with Sansa’s latest dress! I mean look at it!

For a battle dress, it’s hella magnificent! The intricate details in the fabric, the way it accentuates her figure perfectly, it’s honestly just so stunning and regal. She looks so powerful yet feminine at the same time and I think this is the perfect representation of a “jet black leather” outfit in a Westeros time period. Out of all of Sansa’s dresses, I feel like this dress truly makes Sansa look like a Queen. Sansa could be getting more dresses later on in the season but thus far, I definitely believe that this is the best dress of the season 8 and even the best dress in the entire series! To me, this is heads and shoulders above Sansa’s season 6 wolf dress or any dress we’ve seen on this show! Bravo Michelle Clapton! Bravo! 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾

As for what the hell her dress symbolizes I’m not sure. I definitely feel like she’s paying homage to her mother’s roots. Her dress could also hint about a future union to come and a nod to Jon’s heritage as well. I also know that her dress is made to be protective. The thing about it is I really feel that though this dress is protective, Sansa is almost warrior like. Yes, Sansa is on guard but she’s not guarded if that makes sense (lol). If anything, to me I think this dress symbolizes Sansa embracing and radiating a sense of power and leadership. Her in this dress gives me those vibes!

In terms of what it means for her character, I’ll just say this. I said it in my previous meta and I’ll say it again. There is a reason why they have Sansa looking like this in the last season!! This is not by accident and absolutely purposeful! There is no doubt in my mind that they are setting Sansa up not only to be the YMBQ but also Jon Snow’s match. I’m excited to see the evolution of Sansa’s costumes throughout season 8!
